original: Fredriksson, Erik Vilhelm, läroverksadjunkt, Vetlanda, f. 2/4/02 i Kalmar av fanj. Anton Vilhelm Albert F. o. Olivia Nilsson. — Stud:ex. i Kalmar 22, fil. mag. 29, provår v Gbgs folksk:sem. 35. E. o. aman. v. Lunds univ. botan. inst. 25-29, vik. ämneslär. i Klippan 30, e. o. ämneslär. i Avesta 30-31, vik. adj. i Härnösand 31-32, timllär. i Söderhamn 33, e. lär. i Ystad 34, Eslöv 36-37, adj. i geogr. o. biol. v. Vetlanda samrealsk. sed. 37. Led. av lokalstyr. f. Vetlanda samrealsk., folksk :styr. o. stads’fuillm., ordf. i Vetlanda föreläsn:-fören. Skr.: Kalmar detaljhand :om-råde. En ekon.-geogr. studie (Sv. Geogr. Årsbok) samt geogr. art. i Sv. Uppsikbok.
translated: Fredriksson, Erik Vilhelm was a high school teacher in Vetlanda. He was born on April 2nd, 1902 in Kalmar to Sergeant Anton Vilhelm Albert F. and Olivia Nilsson. He completed his studies with a diploma from Kalmar in 1922, a Master of Philosophy in 1929, and a trial year at the Gothenburg school for the people in 1935. He was a temporary assistant at Lund University's botanical institute from 1925-1929, a substitute subject teacher in Klippan in 1930, a regular subject teacher in Avesta from 1930 to 1931, a substitute teacher in Härnösand from 1931 to 1932, a part-time teacher in Söderhamn in 1933, a regular teacher in Ystad in 1934, Eslöv from 1936 to 1937, and a high school teacher in geography and biology at Vetlanda from 1937. He was a member of the local council for Vetlanda high school, the school board, and the city council. He was also the chairman of the Vetlanda lecture association. He wrote the article "Kalmar's retail area: an economic geography study" (Swedish Geography Yearbook) and geography articles for the Swedish Encyclopedia. He married, but the name of his partner is not mentioned.

structured.name: Erik Vilhelm Fredriksson
structured.description: Swedish high school teacher and author of geography articles
